intro: Ardisia lobbiana, commonly known as the Bornean evergreen ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Borneo. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. Ardisia lobbiana typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Its berries, which are red when mature, are an important food source for various bird species.
